subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Need common abbreviation list
msgSnippet: ... Exactly right.  I meant to explain that but forgot to.  An alternative would be to assign #36 to a , which is on the home row; y requires a bit of a
messageBody:
Ted Larson Freeman scripsit:

> The only assignment I puzzled over, initially, was 'y' for #36, given
> that 'V' is used in X-SAMPA. But then I guessed that since it's
> probably the most frequently used letter, you reasoned that you'd like
> to assign a lower-case ASCII letter for efficiency.

Exactly right. I meant to explain that but forgot to. An alternative
would be to assign #36 to "a", which is on the home row; "y" requires
a bit of a stretch. In X-SAMPA, [V] is the STRUT vowel (in North
American and accents), whereas [@] is the true schwa.

--
Winter: MIT, John Cowan
Keio, INRIA, cowan@...
Issue lots of Drafts. http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
So much more to understand!
Might simplicity return? (A "tanka", or extended haiku)
